lines.text: I think you're looking pretty good for three years in the pen.
You see that? I offer the crow my last smoke, and he bites me.
I live where the land meets the sky. Where the eagle and the raven fly free. I live under the sun and the moon.

My name is Silas Crow. I'm 18-years-old. For a year, me and Frank Fencepost been trying to get into this mechanic school. First, they tell us we gotta write a story. Something about something we know. Well, for a long time I couldn't find one, I mean, lots of stuff goes on here, but I couldn't see it as stuff you'd write down.
You know, Sadie, sometimes jail is the best thing to keep a man in shape.
Well, then I guess Silas could use a year or two huh?

You ask me what I'm gonna do, and I see exactly where this is going. And I don't want who it'll make you be and I don't want who it'll make us be! Not for one more minute! And I don't want how sad and fucked up it already makes me feel!
Yeah, I think we broke up.
Hey! It's this hangover and I still got the morning wood, what can I say?

Poppy left the next week, she got to be a waitress in Toronto. Frank said he really didn't give a shit, but I know he didn't mean it. Coyote put the books away. He was always getting in fights after that. Sadie, I didn't see much anymore. She got organized about the trial and trying to get more attention for Native issues, and I know that's really good. But it was a long time and I missed her.
You know Silas, that story you wrote for your entrance exam is pretty good.
Yeah. But Frank's was wicked! I mean, he should get it published.
I think Frank's is the best thing I ever wrote.
I don't want trouble in here. Two things happen to a man in jail. He comes out a killer or he comes out a Christian. Either way, I don't want him in here.

I don't know what they want. I don't know what they fucking want. Have you ever noticed, it's like there's some conspiracy with women. You look at them , they look at each other. You know... they're thinking something, right?
Wonder what it takes to blow up those air bags!
There's a truck full of ugly.

Up till that day, what was always told about Little Margaret was the funny story of how she got her name. Her family's got 12 kids and I guess at the hospital, her Dad forgot they already had a Margaret, and called her Margaret too. But they won't tell that anymore; Little Margaret's got a different story now. You know, the only other time I saw anyone dead was when Joe Buffalo died. He was in a box and looked like he was sleeping. But Little Margaret was murdered and her eyes were wide open when we found her.
We give him an Indian name. He'll like that.
Pin feathers from rare mountain snow eagle. The feathers of flight!
Ah, choosing your animal name. First, you choose your animal, which is your spirit. The animal most like you. For instance, Pete, you are?
I am the Brown Bear. Silas?

I am the Wolverine! I am the Wolverine! What is that sound? It is a gopher. It is the beaver, those cowardly rodents tremble before me. I am the Wolverine! I rip the throats from my enemy, I paint myself with their blood!
Where'd you find this guy, he's excellent?
Now, this is the part where you get your private, secret Indian name. You are Bob! B Bob.
You got a mad dog, you kill it.
McNaughton keeps that .44 in the back of his GTO.
Okay men, round up what you can. We meet at Thompson's Point, first thing in the morning, 7 o'clock.
'I'm a dumb, white motherfucking killer who's never had a light on him and I'm too pissed to see.
Don't be so hard on yourself Clarence. It's not your fault your brain is the same size as your dick!'
Nice to see an Indian with a badge!
Fuck, it's a bitch out man, I'm freezing. Come on man spark that shit up.
Whatya want me to do, light your foot on fire?
Get our of here you turkeys. Don't get cute buster!
Or you'll be pissing ice cubes for the rest of your life.
[to Silas and friends leaving police station]
Felix, do you think women are thinking something?
More than you know, Frank. More than you'll ever know.
Illianna's pregnant, which Ma and McVey are real happy about. No one's talking eh!
